description: get_vnc_console() and get_spice_console() in nova.compute.manager should list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception for rpc.  This prevents the rpc layer from logging a traceback for this exception when raised.  It is an expected type of exception that the client should be left to handle how it would like.
title: nova.compute.manager should list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception

comments.content: get_vnc_console() and get_spice_console() in nova.compute.manager should list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception for rpc.  This prevents the rpc layer from logging a traceback for this exception when raised.  It is an expected type of exception that the client should be left to handle how it would like.

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/24248
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/24248
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1df14918988ba45fc95b6925a617238af398cc50
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 1df14918988ba45fc95b6925a617238af398cc50
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Mar 12 17:21:33 2013 -0400

    List ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception.
    
    get_vnc_console() and get_spice_console() in nova.compute.manager should
    list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception for rpc. This prevents the
    rpc layer from logging a traceback for this exception when raised. It is
    an expected type of exception that the client should be left to handle
    how it would like.
    
    Fix bug 1154301.
    
    Change-Id: I3a359cbb4edbfabea1775e927b6f9947db26a284
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
